snippet: Some people think the Santa Ana winds are named for Satan, from the Spanish word 'satanas.' They are not, but as millions of Southern Californians know, they easily could be.    Named for Santa Ana Canyon south of Los Angeles, where early settlers...
lead_paragraph: Some people think the Santa Ana winds are named for Satan, from the Spanish word 'satanas.' They are not, but as millions of Southern Californians know, they easily could be. Named for Santa Ana Canyon south of Los Angeles, where early settlers first observed them, the winds are most common in the fall.

headline.main: Santa Anas: Weather Worthy of Satan
